text: Somehow my `Base.HOME_PROJECT[]` is set to my latest developed package. So whenever I startup Julia or type `Pkg.activate()`  it activates that folder. How do I reset it back to my original Julia environment?

elements.text: Somehow my `Base.HOME_PROJECT[]` is set to my latest developed package. So whenever I startup Julia or type
it activates that folder. How do I reset it back to my original Julia environment?

text: I've also discovered this discourse and added my comments there: <https://discourse.julialang.org/t/how-to-remove-and-change-the-default-project/24085/2>

attachments.title: How to remove and change the default project
attachments.text: The solution: There is an environment variable JULIA_PROJECT which was the path to ProjA. But it was not an existing path! I suggest that anyone who uses this variable (like JuliaPro or VSCode) first checks if it points to something existing and ignores it otherwise! This is currently not the case.
attachments.fallback: JuliaLang: How to remove and change the default project

elements.text: I've also discovered this discourse and added my comments there:

text: maybe you changed it in your startup.jl?

elements.text: maybe you changed it in your startup.jl?

text: nope, actually it only happens in VSCode I found out
